title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: Life is about the journey, not the destination. Find your personal legend—the path in life that calls to you, and follow it.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor Frankl
description: We don't ask ourselves what the meaning of life is. Life asks us that question when we experience trials and hardship. We answer the question by how we live our lives.

title: The War of Art
author: Steven Pressfield
description: Our desire to do anything worthwhile is met by Resistance—the personification of the force that keeps us from doing our work. As a human being with work to do, your main goal each day is to overcome Resistance.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: This book completely changed my working life. You can be impressively productive by learning to work deeply. You also find incredible satisfaction through deep work.

title: Little Princes
author: Connor Grennan
description: This is a true story about how selfless service changes who you are. It reminds me over and over again that happiness and meaning are found in serving others.

title: Freakonomics
author: Steven D. Levitt and Stephen J. Dubner
description: Freakonomics taught me that thinking can be endlessly entertaining. Things aren't always as they seem. Don't be afraid to ask questions.

title: Mastery
author: Robert Greene
description: Mastery isn't just something that everyone is capable of; it is our duty as members of society to find and follow our path to mastery. Search your soul for passion, and then to pursue it with everything you have.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: Life is short, fragile, and outside our control. The only thing we can truly govern is our character. Live with virtue, act with integrity, and accept what comes.

title: 12 Rules for Life
author: Jordan Peterson
description: Take responsibility for yourself. Stand up straight, tell the truth, and treat others with respect. Order your own life before trying to fix the world.

title: Tao Te Ching
author: Lao Tzu
description: True strength is found in humility. Go with the flow of life, embrace simplicity, and stop fighting battles that don’t need to be fought.

title: Nobody Wants to Read Your Sh*t
author: Steven Pressfield
description: Nobody owes you their attention, and no one cares how much effort you put into making something. If you want to write (or build) something useful, cut your ego and respect your audience. Focus on telling a better story.

title: Surviving Hitler
author: O. Håkan Palm
description: Even in the worst circumstances imaginable, we can choose kindness, courage, and faith. No situation can take away our ability to do good. You can always do something to make things better.

title: The Phoenix Project
author: Gene Kim, Kevin Behr, and George Spafford
description: Work is a system. To succeed, you must limit what’s on your plate, strengthen the flow of work, and continually improve. The same is true in life. This book helped to inspire my personal development philosophy.

title: Principles
author: Ray Dalio
description: All decisions in life can be systematized through principles. Create clear principles to guide your life, refine them through trial and error, and let them anchor you when things get hard.

title: Perennial Seller
author: Ryan Holiday
description: This book gave me a formula for doing creative projects that are useful, have potential to be successful, and that I can be proud of for a very long time. To do work that lasts, focus on quality, usefulness, and meaning.

title: On Writing
author: Stephen King
description: Learn the tools of your trade and get to work. Find a useful activity that pushes your craft forward (like writing), set a quota, and meet it every day without fail.

title: Creativity, Inc.
author: Ed Catmull
description: This is the best book on business, creativity, and finding long-term success that I have ever read. The keys to building a successful team are trust, candor, and facing problems head-on. It is as entertaining as it is inspiring and useful.
